title: SQL ServerATAN()Function

metadata.description: Learn about SQL ServerATAN()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
❯
Example
Return the arc tangent of a number:
SELECT ATAN(2.5);

Definition and Usage
The ATAN() function returns the arc tangent of a number.
Syntax
ATAN(
number
)
Parameter Values
Parameter
Description
number
Required. A numeric value
Technical Details
Works in:
SQL Server (starting with 2008), Azure SQL Database, Azure SQL Data 
  Warehouse, Parallel Data Warehouse
More Examples
Example
Return the arc tangent of a number:
SELECT ATAN(-45.01);

❯
★
+1

summary: This tutorial covers SQL ServerATAN()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use SQL ServerATAN()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of SQL ServerATAN()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
